image.altText: Burnt out car Baja California

props.synopsis: Local police say the brothers' burnt-out car has been found and two men have been arrested. It follows the earlier arrest of a woman who was found with a phone belonging to one of the Australians.

title.children: Missing surfers' burnt-out car found in Mexico

image.altText: A man and his daughter walk with luggage at the domestic terminal in Brisbane airpor.

props.synopsis: From health issues to natural disasters, unexpected civil unrest or serious crimes, there can be real risks in travelling the world.

title.children: Every year millions of Australians jet off overseas — so what happens if something goes wrong while a loved one is travelling?

image.altText: An ankle monitor bracelet

props.synopsis: The Border Force commissioner previously told parliament the final decision-making power over immigration detainee monitoring lies with the minister, despite the prime minister blaming the decision to remove Majid Jamshidi Doukoshkan's ankle bracelet on independent advice.

title.children: PM deflects blame for decision to drop detainee's ankle bracelet — but Border Force says final say rests with minister

image.altText: A masked owl being held in a brown towel with a torch being shone in its eye

props.synopsis: This rare owl has had a lucky escape, thanks to an eagle-eyed home owner, who, along with a house painter and wildlife carers pulled off a rescue effort — and not a moment too soon.

title.children: Masked owl's lucky escape thanks to trio of tradies, wildlife rescue crew

image.altText: A map of Australia showing regional unemployment rates through colour-coding.

props.synopsis: The headline unemployment rate is 3.8 per cent, but that may not reflect the reality of where you live. This data will give you a much better idea.

title.children: What's the unemployment rate in your region? This data tells you

image.altText: Blake Acres looks to handball while a number of Collingwood players surround him

props.synopsis: It doesn't get much bigger than Carlton and Collingwood in a heaving MCG on a Friday night. Follow all the action from this massive blockbuster in our live blog.

title.children: Carlton and Collingwood locked in fierce MCG battle as Robbie Williams leads pre-game tribute

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Pre-match Robbie Williams tribute for Peter MacCallum Foundation
Players stand united against gendered violence
Carlton and Collingwood renew their famous rivalry

image.altText: The Brisbane Broncos' Pat Carrigan attempts to tackle the Sydney Roosters' Brandon Smith.

props.synopsis: The Roosters take on the Broncos up at Lang Park after Manly surrenders a 20-0 first-half lead against the Canberra Raiders at Brookvale Oval. Follow live.

title.children: Raiders pull off stunning comeback from 20-0 down to beat Manly before blockbuster Broncos-Roosters showdown

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: 1' The Broncos and Roosters are off and running
FULL-TIME: Raiders pull off stunning comeback win at Brookvale Oval
Hudson Young is in! The Canberra Raiders are in front!!

image.altText: An aircraft in the sky with Bonza logo.

props.synopsis: Employees say they have been told to seek emergency payments from Centrelink as the troubled airline can't afford to pay them.

title.children: Bonza staff 'screaming and crying' after being told they won't be paid for April

image.altText: Aerial view of one of Tuvalu's islands: a tear-shaped island with houses very close to the land's edge, surrounded by ocean.

props.synopsis: Australia is set to plough $492 million into the Asian Development Bank as it continues to heap pressure on the organisation to overhaul the way it funds major projects in the region.

title.children: Australia to plough $492 million into the Asian Development Bank to better fund major projects in Pacific

image.altText: A photo of Florence wearing a mask facing the camera.

props.synopsis: Around the world, heated debates about abortion are taking place. But in the Pacific, the topic is so taboo, only a handful of people are willing to talk about it. You’re about to hear from some of them.

title.children: 'I have to have sex with you': Inside Vanuatu's disturbing world of unwanted children

image.altText: Headshots of Donald Trump and Joe Biden speaking

props.synopsis: Campus turmoil and abortion rights have put both Joe Biden and Donald Trump under pressure in another eventful week in US politics, writes Jade Macmillan.

title.children: Campus clashes, abortion bans and Trump's court reprieve: 24 hours told us a lot about the US election

image.altText: A woman with blonde hair smiles at the camera.

props.synopsis: The teenage boy who inflicted the fatal wound after breaking into the North Lakes home in 2022, pleaded guilty to her murder earlier this year and is facing a sentencing hearing in Brisbane today.

title.children: Video of Emma Lovell being stabbed to death at her home played in court in front of family

image.altText: People wearing face masks queue near a Qantas sign with rules for carry-on baggage.

props.synopsis: Qantas has identified what caused its app glitch issue on Wednesday that exposed customer data to other travellers, while the Australian share market has finished higher for the week with Afterpay owner Block surging on its profit results.

title.children: Qantas identifies cause of app privacy breach, Afterpay owner surges on soaring profits, ASX ends higher — as it happened

image.altText: A man lies in a hospital bed with monitoring wires on his chest, he is grimacing with his thumbs up and looks uncomfortable

props.synopsis: When Bradley Luke was playing golf earlier this year he was hoping for a hole in one, not life-threatening holes in his leg. He's one of several outback residents to have survived a deadly snake bite in recent months as reptile numbers soar.

title.children: Outback golfer lives to tell tale of deadly snake bite as reptile encounters spike

image.altText: A green streak of light across a sky

props.synopsis: The Eta Aquariids are one of two meteor showers caused by leftover debris from Halley's comet, and this year could be a cracker — experts predict up to 21 meteors an hour.

title.children: One of the best meteor showers in the Southern Hemisphere is about to peak. Here's how to spot it

image.altText: Hand holding a magnifying glass over Tasmanian Government letterhead.

props.synopsis: Tasmania's Integrity Commission has warned politicians not to speculate about which MP is under investigation. But an integrity expert says it is a problem of its own making — lashing it as a "useless" organisation.

title.children: 'An unusually useless organisation': Expert blasts Tasmania's 'hopeless' integrity body

image.altText: Shanika Thomas with mother Jess Tabart.

props.synopsis: A plan for a joyous day at the Burnie public pool for teenager Shanika after a couple of years of poor health quickly turned into a "heartbreaking" ordeal — something her mum says should never have happened.

title.children: 'It was heartbreaking': Mum and daughter's swim faced 16-month wait for council to fix pool lift

image.altText: A man in a hat gestures as if speaking to a crowd.

props.synopsis: Children of asylum seekers who grew up in Australia are speaking out, fearing they will be forced back to countries they've never known under the government's proposed deportation bill. Immigration lawyers say they were failed by a "cruel" system and it is only about to get worse.

title.children: Hobart businessman Arad arrived to Australia by boat, but a new 'deportation bill' could see his kinsfolk sent back

image.altText: A bronze head of an older woman with short hair, looking serious

props.synopsis: A NSW school has mummified human remains in its library. After years of mystery, a mix of science and art has shed more light on who this person was.

title.children: For a century, this human head has been shrouded in mystery. Until now

image.altText: A woman takes a selfie while looking seriously at the camera.

props.synopsis: The heroic actions of a young girl have been outlined in a Melbourne court, which heard the 10-year-old desperately tried to stop a man stabbing her mother to death.

title.children: 'Determined to kill': Melbourne woman stabbed to death by jealous ex-partner, court hears

image.altText: A Manly rugby league players stands holding an award.

props.synopsis: A magistrate who oversaw the inquest into the death of a young Manly Sea Eagles player recommends the NRL consider mandating a two-week period of controlled training acclimatisation after off-season breaks as part of an existing review.

title.children: NRL player Keith Titmuss died after 'inappropriate' training session, coroner finds

image.altText: Composite image if Nicole Kidman and a calico cat.

props.synopsis: Are you across this week's news headlines? Put yourself to the test.

title.children: Weekly news quiz: Bonza cancellations, Nicole Kidman's award and a cat far from home

image.altText: People board plane on tarmac

props.synopsis: A number of strategic issues are blamed for Bonza entering voluntary administration, but some analysts argue it never stood a chance in the first place. Is there still a future where new budget airlines in Australia could thrive?

title.children: Little leg room, crowded aircraft and crammed lockers: Why budget airlines need to do more to survive

image.altText: SA former senator Nick Xenophon announces his intention to return to politics.

props.synopsis: Former senator and lawyer Nick Xenophon is suing his former law firm over its new business name, but the firm's director has hit back, saying "it may be more productive speaking to Elon Musk" about the letter X.

title.children: Can you own a letter of the alphabet? A lawyer is trying to remove 'X' from his former firm's name

image.altText: A photo showing an Indigenous female senator wearing a white dress with a dark background

props.synopsis: Jacinta Nampijinpa Price was a key player in the Voice No campaign. Six months on from the referendum, the senator says she has no regrets, but her views have come at a cost.

title.children: 'No regrets': Jacinta Nampijinpa Price reflects on being the face of the Voice No campaign

image.altText: several people standing around a woman holding a piece of paper.

props.synopsis: The 1864 law had banned all abortions apart from ones to save a patient's life.

title.children: US state of Arizona signs bill to remove 160-year-old abortion ban

image.altText: QandAThumb

props.synopsis: Criminologist and former NSW Police detective Vincent Hurley, who went viral lecturing politicians on Q+A, says there are immediate solutions to keep women and children safe.

title.children: 'How dare you': The ex-cop who lectured politicians on failing women — and how to save more lives

image.altText: A skull sits next to a sculpture made out of clay.

props.synopsis: The Neanderthal woman's skull was discovered in 2018 in a cave in the Zagros Mountains of northern Iraq.

title.children: Archaeologists reveal reconstructed face of 75,000yo Neanderthal woman

image.altText: An close-up of an orangutan in a tree with no wound on his face

props.synopsis: The male orangutan, called Rakus, was observed by researchers as he chewed leaves and applied a plant paste onto a facial wound.

title.children: Orangutan becomes first wild animal seen using a medicinal plant to treat a wound

image.altText: Female State of Origin player Ali Brigginshaw, wearing a Maroon jersey holding a football in front of a bridge

props.synopsis: Queensland selectors have named a squad filled with experience for the first Women's State of Origin game later this month.

title.children: Maroons name experienced squad for Women's State of Origin Game I

image.altText: Three young women with an Iranian background speak to the camera at an migration law rally.

props.synopsis: Children of asylum seekers who grew up in Australia are speaking out, fearing they will be forced back to countries they've never known under the government's proposed deportation bill. Immigration lawyers say they were failed by a "cruel" system and it is only about to get worse.

title.children: These young people are 'fluent Aussies' who grew up in the country. Now they fear being deported

image.altText: A generic image showing a woman holding up a photo of a breast in a bra to her bare chest.

props.synopsis: The US is recommending women get regular breast cancer screening from the age of 40. Australia already does this but it's the country's best-kept secret.

title.children: Is this Australia's best-kept secret? The lifesaving cancer screens more women should know about

image.altText: Two bottles of olive oil held in a hand.

props.synopsis: A group of Broken Hill olive oil enthusiasts planted a grove in the heart of town that went on to supply Bill Granger's restaurants and win international awards.

title.children: How an outback olive oil landed on the tables of Sydney's top restaurants

image.altText: A young professional cricketer, in a jacket, standing a smiling before a match

props.synopsis: English cricketer Josh Baker, who played Country Cricket for Worcestershire, has died aged 20.

title.children: Josh Baker, Worcestershire and England under-19 cricketer, dies aged 20

image.altText: A smart phone with the words Universal Music Group written on it and the Universal logo

props.synopsis: Universal Music Group has reached an agreement with TikTok meaning music by artists such as Billie Eilish, The Beatles and Tame Impala will return to the app.

title.children: Universal and TikTok reach agreement, music to return to social media app
